text: I just made a bet with a friend that I will be off Twitter for one week. 2-1 odds. He put up $5000 to my favorite charity in return, if I lose (and Tweet in the next week), $2500 to his. I have taken the bet. See you in a week... I hope. I will be on @realmoney if you "need" me!
I think you are missing my point. We may be approaching the point where the $ARKK cumulative losses from the peak exceed the cumulative gains. In dollars terms. Nothing to do with you entry point.
SG I am often wrong and always in doubt.
Moreover, the @CNBC @WilfredFrost @saraeisen interview with Cathie Wood, raised many other questions... @realmoney
I can see a combination of factors (bear market and sizeable redemptions/outflows) that contribute to a great deal of pressure on $ARKK shares going forward.

I have absolutely nothing against ARK Invest or Cathie Wood. I simply believe, that $ARKK is an outstanding short based on my analysis on @realmoney. $ARKK shares peaked at $159 and are now trading at $109.

May 06, 2021 | 02:58 PM EDT DOUG KASS ARKKchegos? Speaking of ARK Invest (ARKK) , I wonder (out loud) if we are approaching the point where the amount of investor capital lost in the ETF exceeds the cumulative investor gains since the firm's inception.
It is the principle and optics

So, riddle me this. Why did she sell some $DE stock yesterday at same time explaining, in her @CNBC interview on Friday, why the farm equipment company belonged in an ARK's portfolio! You simply can't do that shit, tout and sell, pump and dump. What am I missing, Cathie Woods?

There are so many questions with regard to ARK Invest $ARKK that have surfaced with Cathie Woods' interview on @CNBC. Yesterday, AFTER explaining why $DE qualifies and is attractive to $ARKK, she actually sold some stock on Friday. @jimcramer @tomkeene @SquawkCNBC @andrewrsorkin
